page.title: 03THE LEN VALLEY BOTTOM
page.content: Although the Len is a minor river running in a shallow valley the region is fairly flat and affords good communication routes for the A.20 and the railway between Ashford and Maidstone. The soil is fertile and easily worked giving good pasture as well as arable farming and horticulture. Very little wetland is found except that near streams and ponds. Many springs rise from the base of the chalk where it overlays the Gault clay, but are of little importance today. Extensive beds of building sand of the Folkestone beds have been worked in the recent past but none are in current use. Many of these quarries are being or will be infilled with domestic refuse.
